headline.main: DURHAM, N.C., PROGRAMS AID HEART PATIENTS

docs.lead_paragraph: Two or three mornings a week, Larry Rogers goes to the Duke University football stadium, warms up with calisthenics and then jogs around the track. The 51-year-old Mr. Rogers, who suffered a heart attack last year, is one of about 3,500 people who have been helped by the Duke University Preventive Approach to Cardiovascular Disease, which has been offered to the 150,000 residents of this city and surrounding area. The city is using the heart disease program and other health approaches in its three-year, $150,000 ''City of Medicine'' advertising campaign. The campaign is an attempt to lure industry and residents to the area.
